estraiersearch.description: The search results are output as a loop using Hyper Estraier.

attributes.prefix: Add a prefix to the variable being set.
attributes.query: Search phrase (When 'query' parameter is specified, it takes precedence).
attributes.no_query: Search with no keywords and only attribute specification.
attributes.offset: Starts N value from the start of the list. N is a positive integer.
attributes.limit: A positive integer to limit results.
attributes.and_or: When searching multiple keywords, specify 'and' search or 'or' search.
attributes.separator: When searching multiple keywords, split phrase by separator(default value is ' ').
attributes.ngram: Morphological analyzers are not used for keyword extraction.
attributes.ad_attr(s): Name of attribute(s). Specify string or array.
attributes.add_condition(s): Attribute search condition(s). Specify string or array. See https://dbmx.net/hyperestraier/uguide-en.html
attributes.values(s): Value(s) of attribute search. Specify string or array.
attributes.snippet_width: Specifies the number of whole width of snippet and width of strings picked up from the beginning of the text and width of strings picked up around each highlighted word.

variables.estcmd_cmd: Command executed on the web server.
variables.(note): About variables after this, When the 'prefix' attribute is specified, a prefix is added to the beginning of all variables.
variables.title: The title of document.
variables.author: The document's author name.
variables.tags: Tags attached to the document(Comma separated values).
variables.metadata: The value of the primary column of the object associated with the document in the relation(Comma separated values).
variables.extracted: Keywords automatically extracted when the environment variable 'searchestraier_auto_keywords' is specified.

estraierjson.description: The search results are output as a JSON format using Hyper Estraier.

attributes.prefix: Add a prefix to the variable being set.
attributes.query: Search phrase (When 'query' parameter is specified, it takes precedence).
attributes.no_query: Search with no keywords and only attribute specification.
attributes.offset: Starts N value from the start of the list. N is a positive integer.
attributes.limit: A positive integer to limit results.
attributes.and_or: When searching multiple keywords, specify 'and' search or 'or' search.
attributes.separator: When searching multiple keywords, split phrase by separator(default value is ' ').
attributes.ad_attr(s): Name of attribute(s). Specify string or array.
attributes.add_condition(s): Attribute search condition(s). Specify string or array. See https://dbmx.net/hyperestraier/uguide-en.html
attributes.values(s): Value(s) of attribute search. Specify string or array.
attributes.snippet_width: Specifies the number of whole width of snippet and width of strings picked up from the beginning of the text and width of strings picked up around each highlighted word.
attributes.attributes: An array of attributes to retrieve or comma-separated text. Specify 'all' to get all.

variables.(premise): The tag's variable is a JSON key(Not a template variable).
variables.estcmd_cmd: Command executed on the web server.
variables.(note): About variables after this, When the 'prefix' attribute is specified, a prefix is added to the beginning of all variables.
variables.title: The title of document.
variables.author: The document's author name.
variables.tags: Tags attached to the document(Comma separated values).
variables.metadata: The value of the primary column of the object associated with the document in the relation(Comma separated values).
variables.extracted: Keywords automatically extracted when the environment variable 'searchestraier_auto_keywords' is specified.
